availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Hudgens (Ballard County, Kentucky, apprentice, farmer, and convict)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, apprentice, farmer, and convict. Tennessee native. Son of William H. Hudgens and Martha Hudgens. Student in Montgomery County, Tennessee, in 1850. Apprentice in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Ballard County in 1863. Convicted of robbery in Ballard Circuit Court in September 1863. Prisoner in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County, p. 152B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville, p. 717.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville, p. 452B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Ballard County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 15.
KYR-0001-004-0459.
